website_summaries.verdict: The Sennheiser PXC 550-II headphones deliver excellent noise cancellation and strong audio performance in a user-friendly design.
pros: Strong audio performance with rich bass depth and sculpted highs
cons: Headphones can feel a little tight

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation is just not on the level of Bose QCs or NC 700 , and the sound is not as good as on the Bose or on Sony 1000XM3. I don't get a seal around my ears (possibly because I wear glasses, but the headphones couldn't answer the question, why pick this over the alternatives? I also had issues pairing with more than one device, and then whilst connected to the one phone, I could listen to music, but when I received a phone call, the headphones couldn't pick it up. Poor tbh, which is a shame because I really wanted to like them.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Meh....Not worth the extra £100 above PXC 550
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to the updated model of the pxc 550 which I very much enjoyed wearing. Unfortunately on receipt the hinges on the headphones seemed to creak and made worse when wearing glasses, had to return in the end as the creaking sound overpowered the music! Also seems more plasticky than the previous editions. Save yourself over a hundred pounds and buy the original Model

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fully support fully patched iOS devices
customer_reviews.text: Not fully compatible with iOS 13.4 but apart from that these are very good headphones. When trying to set these up with the Sennheiser app you get a message saying there will be a firmware update soon but you need an iOS 13.2 or earlier or Android phone to apply it - which, in my case, is going to be difficult
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Too buggy and sensitive ‘cup’
customer_reviews.text: I returned these because there were two many bugs. A slight move of my head put calls on hold and dropped them. You cannot turn off the ‘cup’ for calls and so gently brushing it immediately drops calls. I tried various different methods of resetting them via the app but my frustration remained. For such an expensive set of headphones I expected much more. Very disappointed as I really would find a wireless headset useful. I’ve some B&O wired headphones and they are great but not wireless. Maybe it was just my headphones that were buggy but it dropped some important calls so I didn’t have time for it.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Great product, minor flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent noise cancellation. Big-ear compatible. Sound lacks deep bass outright but is otherwise well balanced - their app needs some work. Settings can be adjusted with iPhone’s equaliser in Music so above is not a massive negative. Case is a bit flimsy but is compact - not hard shell. Includes mini USB charging cable and plane cable connector/adaptor. Ear cups feel premium. Light on ears. The extendable arms could have been 2-3 notches longer but personally ok.
customer_reviews.author: Veteran buyer

customer_reviews.title: any cheap headphones louder than this...baaaaad
customer_reviews.text: OMG didn't expect such a bad product from Sennheiser...I can hear everything around me while Im listening music...snd isn't loud enough at all...refunding it...
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Returned due to limited EQ app
customer_reviews.text: I returned these when I realised that the app did not provide a graphic EQ facility as shown on the website. It merely allowed you to select a preset from a very limited set, none of which was useful to me. Consequently, I did not get around to fully testing them.
customer_reviews.author: NigelH

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: So far best headphones I've ever owned I'm no expert regarding headphones but these seem well made and the sound is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Better bass and sound than the first pear,they looks great too
customer_reviews.author: david hanbury

customer_reviews.title: Great noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Very good and perfect for the train commute so I don’t hear people chatting rubbish 👌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived safely to me, and im glad there wasn't any trouble to deliver it
customer_reviews.author: Raymond S.

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these, they look great, sound great, the noise cancelling is excellent. Everything you expect from a top-end brand like Sennheiser. I bought these to replace my aging MM 550-X headphones and I'm not disappointed. Battery life is great and with Bluetooth, USB and "normal" audio cable there's plenty of connection options available. I'd prefer a proper on/off switch rather than the ear-piece rotation these use, and after a couple of hours wear with glasses they can be a little uncomfortable. Maybe this will change over time. Overall, can't recommend these enough, already trying to persuade my wife she needs a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Grant MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth is limited and unnecessarily complicated!
customer_reviews.text: Can only connect with Bluetooth via their app. The app doesn't work on Apple IOS!? Why cant they just have a button that turns Bluetooth on, so you can pair to any device? For the price, they aren't that comfy either. They may look it, but the headband pushes through the support and aches a bit on the head. This is the second pair of Bluetooth headphones I've attempted with Sennheiser after using them for decades. Unfortunately, I've now given up with the brand. Time to shop around again. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: steve d.

customer_reviews.title: Don't but - this model will not work with your PC!
customer_reviews.text: The headphones will pair via bluetooth with a Windows-based PC, but they won't work. This is a well-documented issue, with seemingly hundreds of buyers complaining about the same problem. The manufacturer seems unable to fix the matter, so the only working recommendation is to use the headphones with the USB cable - when indeed they work. For the price, you can get a lot better than wireless headphones having to be cable-wired into your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Zdravko Mladenov

customer_reviews.title: Earpad sticthing coming undone
customer_reviews.text: After 11 months the stitching in one of the earpads has started to come undone. The earphones are very solid and everything so far has been great. I even bought a hard shell case to carry them protected (the case for the MB 660 fits these perfectly). Unfortunately the earpad stitching is going and for the price of this product I would expect this to last for at least 2 ears before witnessing any flaking or stitching on the earpads or headband to go bad.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Turn on and off randomly
customer_reviews.text: Had for about 3 days and just randomly started to turn on and off on and off not sure how to fix this, the noise cancellation is great and so is the sound
customer_reviews.author: Callum39473883

product_meta.title: Sennheiser PXC 550-II Wireless Headphone with Alexa Built-In, Noise Cancellation and Smart Pause - Black
product_meta.description: Created for the frequent Traveller, the PXC 550-II WIRELESS upgrades every journey with exceptional comfort, unrivalled sound quality and wireless freedom. The triple microphone array also delivers unrivalled speech clarity when making calls on the move, or interacting with virtual assistants such as Siri, Google and Alexa via the voice assistant button. With exceptional ergonomic design and up to 30 hours of battery life, The PFC 550-ii wireless is the perfect companion for travelling in style.
feature_bullets: Superior sound quality and active noise cancellation: the PXC 550-II Wireless delivers Sennheiser legendary sound quality. Active noise cancellation reduces the ambient noise around you and can be adjusted to your preference
Exceptional battery performance up to 30 hours: The PXC 550-II Wireless delivers up to 30 hours of battery life. You can travel from London to Hong Kong and back with just one charge
One touch access to voice assistant: with the touch of a single button you have access to your AI helper: Siri, Hey Google and Alexa, Frequency range: Speaker: 17 – 23,000 Hz (-10db)

Touch pad control: a touch pad on the right ear cup provides volume, play, stop, pause and track skipping control. Touching the ear cup allows you to take an incoming call. Controlling this headset is instinctive and easy
Smart pause (activated via the app)/ auto on/off: swivel the ear cups to turn off, sensors detect when you wear the headphone and play/ pause music
Alexa built-in devices let you instantly connect to Alexa to play music, control your smart home, get information, news, weather, and more using just your voice.

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
